intro: Kedrostis cufodontii, commonly known as the African burr grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with palmately lobed leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruit, which is covered in hooked spines, is adapted for animal dispersal, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Kedrostis cufodontii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
